description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Tom Capper October 18, 2024 Google HCU: What Can You Do? — Whiteboard Friday Whiteboard Friday | Search Engines | Algorithm Updates In this week’s episode of Whiteboard Friday, Tom follows up on his previous blog post about the Helpful Content Update and provides actionable insights into what you can do if you’ve been impacted by this rollout. Read this post By: Tom Capper September 5, 2024 The Helpful Content Update Was Not What You Think Search Engines | Algorithm Updates Are Google’s Helpful Content Updates affecting your rankings in unexpected ways? It might not be just about your content. As the August update rollout wraps, we can expect some winners and some losers, but why? Tom Capper digs into the data and reveals the surprising reality of what sites impacted by the Helpful Content Update have in common. Read this post By: Ann Smarty August 20, 2024 How to Optimize for Google's Featured Snippets [Updated for 2024] Advanced SEO | Search Engines | On-page SEO Google’s featured snippets started as an experiment almost a decade ago. They have since become an integral part of Google’s SERPs, showing up for lots of queries. Making them part of your SEO strategy is essential to build more traffic. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers August 8, 2024 How Will Google’s Antitrust Ruling Affect You? Search Engines | Marketing Industry What does the recent Google antitrust ruling mean for us as search marketers? What happened and where do we go from here? Dr. Pete Meyers walks through the TL;DR of the ruling and what that may mean for the marketing industry. Read this post By: Tom Capper July 31, 2024 AI Bots — Who is Blocking and Why? AI and SEO | Search Engines Are you considering blocking AI bots? Perhaps you think it's crazy but want to see who it is. Tom Capper digs into the robots.txt of major sites to reveal who is blocking AI bots. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis July 29, 2024 What I Learned About Search From Listening to 2 Musicians Search Engines | Marketing Industry It’s time to rethink formulas. We need to be more fluid in our strategies and more whimsical in the risks we’re willing to take. Discover what Miriam learned about search from listening to 2 musicians. Read this post By: Will Critchlow July 19, 2024 Testing Ideas From the Google API Leaks — Whiteboard Friday Whiteboard Friday | Search Engines How do we know what is and what isn’t a Google ranking factor? In this episode, Will reveals four testing ideas relating to the Google API leaks to help answer that question. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis July 15, 2024 The 11 Known Google Business Profile Fields That Impact Your Rank Local SEO | Search Engines In this blog post, Miriam discusses 11 Google Business Profile fields that can have a positive impact on how you rank. Read this post By: Garrett Sussman July 5, 2024 Optimizing for AI Overviews — Whiteboard Friday Search Engines | Whiteboard Friday | AI and SEO In this Whiteboard Friday, Garrett discusses AI Overviews and how to optimize your SEO strategy for this new super-charged AI-powered search ranking snippet. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis July 2, 2024 Google Business Profile: FAQ for Multiple Businesses at the Same Address Local SEO | Search Engines How should I get listed in my Google Business Profile if I’ve got multiple businesses at the same address? How many listings am I eligible for if I’m running more than one business at my location? Get answers to your top questions in this comprehensive FAQ. Read this post By: Tom Capper June 25, 2024 Google’s Navboost Queries and Brands in SEO Marketing Industry | Search Engines | Algorithm Updates Are you still sleeping on brand as a ranking factor? Explore Tom’s detailed takeaways from the Google leak, with an emphasis on understanding Navboost queries, a click-based ranking system, and branded search. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis June 10, 2024 How to Optimize Your Place of Worship’s Google Business Profile to Create a Warm Welcome Local SEO | Search Engines Ongoing efforts with elements like updates, photos, and review responses show that your institution is an active, welcoming one that cares to be found and chosen by neighbors. Learn how to optimize your place of worship’s Google Business Profile with Miriam’s eight tips. Read this post By: Tom Capper May 31, 2024 4 Insights From the Google Leak — Whiteboard Friday Whiteboard Friday | Search Engines | Marketing Industry In this Whiteboard Friday, Tom touches on four particular insights gleaned from the recent Google documentation leak. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis May 27, 2024 Google's AI Search Fails: From Bizarre Misinformation to Public Health Risks Search Engines | Marketing Industry | AI and SEO Google's AI search results are meant to quickly deliver information to searchers, but it is delivering misinformation that ranges from plain bizarre to perilous to public health. Miriam rounds up some of the oddest AI overviews we've seen, explains why we’re being exposed to this feature, and focuses on a famous reality-check anecdote. Read this post
